results.title: The Half-masted schooner
results.creator_credit: Bruce Mackay, Joseph Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film combining a tuneful ballad with an equally engaging kaleidoscope of pictures, some relating to the story of the song and some not, but all most cheering and amusing to the eye. The soft focus of the live photography and the pleasing patterns of abstract designs combine with the relaxed mood of the ballad to produce an agreeable interlude of sights and sounds. Spawned from the hippy experimental culture of the time.

results.title: The Gunston tapes
results.brief_description: Contains the best of the Norman Gunston shows. The video includes Warren Beatty and the Qantas air hostess, Hugh Heffner, Muhammad Ali, Keith Moon assaulting “The Little Aussie Bleeder” with a vodka bottle, and the Spaceship Southern Hemisphere.

results.title: The Green hornet. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Ford Beebe, Ray Taylor and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Volume 2 contains chapters 7 to 13. Based on the successful radio serial of the same name, Britt Reid (Gordon Jones) as the Green Hornet and his crime fighting partner, Kato (Keye Luke) battle against organised crime’s king-pins. The Green Hornet is the direct descendant of the famous masked crime fighter, The Lone Ranger. He’s the Lone Ranger’s grand nephew. This movie serial used the same principle characters that featured in the radio play as well as the famous Hornet musical signature (Flight of the Bumble Bee) and gadgetry such as a gas gun to incapacitate criminals. Also used is the voice of Al Hodge, the radio Green Hornet, which was heard when crusading publisher Britt Reid spoke from behind the Hornet mask. Also stars Anne Nagel as Lenore Case.

results.title: The Great New Zealand Fishing Safari
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Action Downunder”.
Geoff Thomas and his guests travel throughout New Zealand in search of the best fishing. He and his guests journey to some of New Zealand’s most spectacular locations in search of striped marlin, rainbow trout, mako sharks, snapper and many more. One in a series of films which capture some of the world’s most exciting fishing action.

results.title: The Great primitives. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Auguste Lumiere, Louis Lumiere and Jason Films Productions
results.brief_description: A collection of excerpts from some early pioneer films made between 1895-1912. The films included are; “Lumiere Premiere Program”, made in 1895; “A Trip to the Moon”, made in 1902; “Great Train Robbery”, made in 1903; and, a series of animations done by Cohl between 1908-1912.

results.title: The Great mouse detective
results.creator_credit: Burny Mattinson, David Michener, John Musker, Ron Clements and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Early computer animated Disney feature, features the mellifluous tones of Vincent Price as Professor Rattigan, a Sherlock Homes type character who is a master of mystery sleuthing. Set in Victoria London, England Rattigan (a highly intelligent scientific mouse) is joined by various cohorts on the trail of the abducted father of a little mouse. An entertaining effort directed at children, that charms in many ways with its gentle humour and fun characterisations.

results.title: The Great Karoo
results.creator_credit: Trevor de Kock, Colin Cradock, BBC and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: The Great Karoo stretches for over a quarter of a million miles occupying most of the inner land mass of the Cape Province of South Africa. It was called “The Great Dry” by early human inhabitants and its harsh climate with extreme temperatures make it a hostile environment for its animals. From the Black Eagle, to the tiniest mouse, the animals survive. This is an opportunity to explore one of the most arid, but most beautiful environments in the world.

results.title: The Great Gatsby
results.creator_credit: Jack Clayton, David Merrick, Newdorn Company and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: F. Scott Fitzgerald’s masterpiece is a story that could only have taken place in the Jazz Age: an era in which recklessness with money, liquor, women and fast cars pervaded the American consciousness. Robert Redford is Jay Gatsby, the dashing, enigmatic millionaire obsessed with the elusive and spoiled Daisy Buchanan (Mia Farrow). The screenplay for this elegant story was conceived with a meticulous concern for language, time and place by Francis Ford Coppola. Cast also includes Karen Black, Scott Wilson, Sam Waterson, Lois Chiles, Bruce Dern, Howard da Silva, Patsy Kensit.
